mbean.description: This MBean is a managed queue to which one or more supplier threads is adding items (objects) and one or more consumer threads is removing them.
mbean.attribute: The number of items that have been removed from the queue.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) supplier threads have waited to add items to the queue because it was full.
Will be true if the queue is suspended.
Will be true if the queue is full.
Will be true if the queue is empty.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) consumer threads have waited to remove items from the queue because it was empty.
The maximum number of items that may coexist in the queue at any one instant. Also referred to as the queue depth.
mbean.operation: Suspends activity in the queue. All threads are blocked until the resume operation is invoked.
Enables logging of trace-level information. To turn this feature off, invoke disableTracing.
mbean.notification: This notification is sent when logic internal to the queue has determined that the queue is stalled in some way. This usually means that no processing has occurred for more than 10000 ms (10 seconds) and other attributes of the class need to be investigated to resolve the problem.
